verbs.description: outstare (third-person singular simple present outstares, present participle outstaring, simple past and past participle outstared)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To stare at (someone) so hard or long that they look away.
examples: He held a tray but did not move from where he stood and managed, without any trace of emotion, to outstare Henry, who was standing in a group, half-listening to an anecdote.
